description: Nucleus is a membrane-bound structure inside a living cell that controls the cell metabolism and reproduction.
heading: "Chromosomes","DNA","Eukaryotic cell","Nucleoplasm","Chromatin fibers","Nucleus","Nuclear membrane","Nucleolus","Cytoplasm","Lipids","Ribosomes","Nuclear pores"
head_description: "A threadlike structure found in the nucleus of most living cells, carrying genetic information in the form of genes.","Deoxyribonucleic acid, a self-replicating material that carries individual hereditary characteristics in a cell, the main constituent of chromosomes.","A cell containing a membrane-bound nucleus and organelles.","The fluid within the nucleus of a eukaryotic cell surrounding the chromosomes and nucleolus.","The material that makes up the chromosomes of eukaryotes.","A membrane-bound large structure inside a living cell that controls the cell metabolism and reproduction.","The double-layered membrane enclosing the nucleus of a cell.","A spherical granule in the nucleus, composed of protein and RNA, synthesizes ribosomes.","The viscous liquid inside a cell but outside the cell's nucleus.","Molecules that are insoluble in water and soluble in organic solvents. Include fats, oils, waxes, sterols, and triglycerides.","The minute particles synthesized by the nucleolus, consisting of RNA and associated proteins. ","Protein-lined channels in the nuclear envelope which regulate the transportation of molecules between the nucleus and cytoplasm."
